content:
@Kenny Lau What is your plan with this PR? There was a suggestion by Neil:

I would vote for using the more constructive and logically elementary versions of these concepts. A commutative ring is local iff (1 : A) ≠ 0 ∧ ∀ (a : A), (is_unit a) ∨ (is_unit (1 - a)). An element a : A lies in the Jacobson radical iff ∀ (x : A), is_unit (1 + a * x).

The change to local rings has been made. Do you want to make the change to the definition of the Jacobson radical?
